taxonConcepts.scientificName: Brachyplatystoma vaillantii (Valenciennes in Cuvier and Valenciennes, 1840)
Brachyplatystoma vaillantii (Valenciennes in Cuvier and Valenciennes, 1840)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Juveniles and subadults frequently found at river mouths and estuaries.  Occurs downstream from the first falls where the water is charged with mud and the bottom is muddy.  In the Amazon, it can sometimes be caught in the upper part up to the foot of the Andean range where it appears to be more rare than Brachyplatystoma filamentosum and Brachyplatystoma flavicus but never in the zones prone to flood.  Reproductive migrations probably occur like in other Brachyplatystoma (Ref. 35381).  Usually caught with longlines and drift nets (Ref. 35381).  Its flesh of excellent quality is highly appreciated.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: Amazon and Orinoco River basins and major rivers of Guianas and northeastern Brazil: Bolivia, Brazil, Colombia, Ecuador, French Guiana, Peru, Suriname, Trinidad and Tobago, and Venezuela.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: South America:  Amazon and Orinoco River basins and major rivers of the Guianas and northeastern Brazil.
dataObjects.references: Lundberg, J.G. and M.W. Littmann 2003 Pimelodidae (Long-whiskered catfishes). p. 432-446. In R.E. Reis, S.O. Kullander and C.J. Ferraris, Jr. (eds.) Checklist of the Freshwater Fishes of South and Central America. Porto Alegre: EDIPUCRS, Brasil. (Ref. 36506)

dataObjects.title: Max. size

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Migration
dataObjects.description: Potamodromous. Migrating within streams, migratory in rivers, e.g. Saliminus, Moxostoma, Labeo.  Migrations should be cyclical and predictable and cover more than 100 km.
